CWEs: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
description: The function 'whereis' is vulnerable to command injection because it concatenates the 'name' parameter directly into the command string that is executed by the 'cp.exec' function. An attacker could provide a malicious 'name' parameter that includes command line special characters, allowing them to execute arbitrary commands on the system.
